output:
The recommended frequency of exercise for most adults is at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity or 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity aerobic activity per week. This can be broken down into smaller chunks of time, such as 30 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise five days a week or 25 minutes of vigorous-intensity exercise three days a week.

Strength training exercises should be performed at least twice a week, with one to three sets of 12-15 repetitions for each exercise.

It is important to note that the optimal exercise frequency for you may vary depending on your individual fitness level, goals, and lifestyle. If you are new to exercise, it is best to start slowly and gradually increase the frequency and intensity of your workouts over time. Listening to your body and resting when needed is also important to avoid injury.

user_input: Give me a simple exercise plan for a day
output:
Simple Exercise Plan for a Day

Warm-up (5 minutes)

• Jumping jacks: 20 repetitions
• Arm circles: 20 repetitions forward, 20 repetitions backward
• High knees: 20 repetitions

Workout (25 minutes)

Cardio (10 minutes)

• Running in place: 1 minute
• Jumping jacks: 1 minute
• High knees: 1 minute
• Rest: 1 minute
• Repeat 3 times

Strength training (15 minutes)

• Bodyweight squats: 3 sets of 10-12 repetitions
• Push-ups (modified on knees if needed): 3 sets of 8-10 repetitions
• Lunges: 3 sets of 12-15 repetitions per leg
• Plank: Hold for 30-60 seconds, 3 sets

Cool-down (5 minutes)

• Stretching: Hold each stretch for 30 seconds
    • Quad stretch
    • Hamstring stretch
    • Calf stretch
    • Chest stretch
• Foam rolling (optional)

Tips:

• Listen to your body and rest when needed.
• Focus on form and proper technique.
• Gradually increase intensity and duration over time.
• Have fun and enjoy the process!
